questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Using the information provided, comment on the validity of the data collection process.

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Use information from Table 1 and Figure 3 to write a short report on the guiding question 'How do tourists from different countries of origin obtain travel information for their holiday in Bagan?'

questions.question: Describe how they would have carried out the land use survey.

questions.question: Explain how they can use the data collected from the land use survey and tally counting in Table 2 to help them arrive at a conclusion on their hypothesis

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Use Figure 4 to explain why the development of medical tourism in Thailand can bring about both positive and negative impacts on the local people.

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: Which do you think is a more effective strategy to ensure tourism development is sustainable in the long run? Support your answer using evidence

questions.question: Describe the trends in food consumption in Singapore from 1998 to 2010 and explain how economic factors have contributed to the changes.

questions.question: Using the information in Figure 6 to describe and account for the changes in the diets of the people in Venezuela between 2014 to 2016.

questions.question: Using the information in Figure 7, describe the distribution of Singapore's sources of food imports.

questions.question: Compare the changes in fast food consumption from 1985 to 2015

questions.subject: Humanities(Geography)
questions.question: 'Variations in food consumption in the world is caused more by natural factors than by political factors'. To what extent do you agree with this statement? Support your answer with evidence.
